issues.title: Cell border sometimes remains expanded after exiting edit mode (regression from v6.7.0 to v6.20.4)
issues.author: web-delivery
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

https://stackblitz.com/edit/github-mpav2dlm?file=src%2Fdemo.tsx

Steps:
1. Click a cell to enter edit mode (the cell border expands).
2. Enter a value.
3. Click outside the grid to exit edit mode.
4. The cell border is expected to shrink back to the normal non-editing size.
5. However, in version 6.20.4, the border occasionally remains expanded as if still in edit mode.
6. Repeat several times. The issue occurs intermittently (approximately 1 out of 10 times).

### Current behavior

After leaving edit mode, the cell border sometimes does not return to its normal size and remains in the "editing" visual state. This happens intermittently (around 10% of the time).

### Expected behavior

When exiting edit mode, the cell border should always shrink back to the normal size. 
This behavior worked correctly in version 6.7.0.

### Context

The issue started after upgrading:
- "@mui/x-data-grid": "^6.7.0"  → "^6.20.4"
- "@mui/x-data-grid-pro": "^6.7.0" → "^6.20.4"

Impact: UI display issue only; data registration is not affected.
Possibly related to grids with row-addition enabled (not fully confirmed).

Support key (Order ID): 118470
Submitted by Tegara Corp. on behalf of our customer in Japan.

### Your environment

MUI X DataGrid Pro version affected: 6.20.4
Previously working version: 6.7.0


**Search keywords**: datagrid, datagrid pro, edit mode, cell border, border not shrinking, layout issue, intermittent, regression, v6.20.4, v6.7.0

**Order ID**: 118470
issues.summary: Cell border sometimes remains expanded after exiting edit mode (regression from v6.7.0 to v6.20.4)

issues.title: [question]  Vulnerability in minimatch causing npm audit to fail
issues.author: justin-wilxite
issues.body:
### The problem in depth

Hi, sorry if the solution here is obvious but there's a recent security vulnerability in minimatch and it seems like @mui/x-internal-exceljs-fork has a dependency on it

https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3ppc-4f35-3m26

If I use the latest MUI X I get this output from `npm audit fix --force`

```
# npm audit report

minimatch  <10.2.1
Severity: high
minimatch has a ReDoS via repeated wildcards with non-matching literal in pattern - https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3ppc-4f35-3m26
fix available via `npm audit fix`
node_modules/archiver-utils/node_modules/minimatch
node_modules/readdir-glob/node_modules/minimatch
  glob  3.0.0 - 10.5.0
  Depends on vulnerable versions of minimatch
  node_modules/archiver-utils/node_modules/glob
    archiver-utils  >=0.2.0
    Depends on vulnerable versions of glob
    node_modules/archiver-utils
      archiver  >=0.20.0
      Depends on vulnerable versions of archiver-utils
      Depends on vulnerable versions of readdir-glob
      Depends on vulnerable versions of zip-stream
      node_modules/archiver
        @mui/x-internal-exceljs-fork  *
        Depends on vulnerable versions of archiver
        node_modules/@mui/x-internal-exceljs-fork
          @mui/x-data-grid-premium  >=8.15.0
          Depends on vulnerable versions of @mui/x-internal-exceljs-fork
          node_modules/@mui/x-data-grid-premium
      zip-stream  0.8.0 - 6.0.1
      Depends on vulnerable versions of archiver-utils
      node_modules/zip-stream
  readdir-glob  <=2.0.1
  Depends on vulnerable versions of minimatch
  node_modules/readdir-glob

8 high severity vulnerabilities

To address all issues, run:
  npm audit fix
```

However if I downgrade to an earlier version of MUI X it still fails:

```
@mui/x-data-grid-premium  <=8.14.1
          Depends on vulnerable versions of exceljs
          node_modules/@mui/x-data-grid-premium
```

### Your environment

<details>
  <summary>`npx @mui/envinfo`</summary>

```
  Don't forget to mention which browser you used.
  Output from `npx @mui/envinfo` goes here.
```
</details>

issues.author: mbiggs-gresham

The docs give an example of maintaining the group expansion state here https://mui.com/x/react-data-grid/server-side-data/row-grouping/#row-expansion-state-persistence however this is triggered from a button click. How would you achieve the same when the sort model changes for example?

1. Sort model changes
2. `getRows` is called and new data returned
3. Expanded state is lost

issues.title: [data grid] Row grouping with a datasource doesn't respect the order the rows are returned
issues.author: mbiggs-gresham
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce Steps: 1. Open this link to live example: https://mui.com/x/react-data-grid/server-side-data/row-grouping/#implementating-server-side-row-grouping 2. Expand a few groups in the demo 3. Apply a sort to a column (eg title) 4. The sort is never respected. ### Current behavior When using a datasource with row grouping, the order in which the rows are returned from the `getRows` is never respected after the first render. I've tried invaliding the cache, but it never seems to update. In my own code i'm returning an array of 2 parent rows ordered [0, 1]. When the sortmodel updates, I flip the rows to [1, 0] but the grid never updates to reflect this. ### Expected behavior Changing the order of the rows from `getRows` should be reflected in the grid. ### Context I want group grids using a datasource to be updated when I update the sortmodel. ### Your environment
npx @mui/envinfo ``` Don't forget to mention which browser you used. Output from `npx @mui/envinfo` goes here. ```
**Search keywords**: datasource row grouping **Order ID**: 45466
issues.summary: [data grid] Row grouping with a datasource doesn't respect the order the rows are returned

issues.title: [charts] Warn users when the controlled tooltip does not match the trigger
issues.author: alexfauquette
issues.body:
If the user is controlling the state then it is an intentional behaviour, it is not about "magic", it is about user intention.

How likely is it that the user will update the state without wanting it to be updated? 😆

We could at least warn users if they update the state and it won't have any effect 🤷

_Originally posted by @JCQuintas in https://github.com/mui/mui-x/pull/21351#discussion_r2822409299_
issues.summary: [charts] Warn users when the controlled tooltip does not match the trigger

issues.title: [data grid] getRowId prop does not work with server-side tree data
issues.author: ahmedBilal5
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce The server-side tree data grid is having problems when row id is provided through the `getRowId `prop instead of from the data itself. Steps: 1. Open this [link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/wyr8jahq-evdddasn?file=src%2FDemo.tsx) to live example. A data-grid-pro using server side tree data should load. 2. Expand a node in the tree. 3. Do either of a. Collapse the same node and expand it again. b. Click _Increment the counter_ to re-calculate memoized datasource. Error: > Uncaught Error: MUI X: The Data Grid component requires all rows to have a unique `id` property. > Alternatively, you can use the `getRowId` prop to specify a custom id for each row. > A row was provided without id when calling updateRows(): Adding id property to the data itself and removing `getRowId` prop makes the grid work fine @arminmeh @MBilalShafi ### Current behavior Error: > Uncaught Error: MUI X: The Data Grid component requires all rows to have a unique `id` property. > Alternatively, you can use the `getRowId` prop to specify a custom id for each row. > A row was provided without id when calling updateRows(): ### Expected behavior grid should work same as it does when adding id property to the data itself and removing `getRowId` prop ### Context _No response_ ### Your environment
npx @mui/envinfo ``` Don't forget to mention which browser you used. Output from `npx @mui/envinfo` goes here. ```

issues.title: [data grid] Group row at bottom?
issues.author: mbiggs-gresham
issues.body:
### Summary

What would be the possibility of the group grid supporting the group row being at the bottom underneath the expanded child rows? So group row is present, expand it, and it shunts down to underneath the children. This may only make sense for grids with only 1 level deep. 

In many financial applications you want the aggregate data for each group to be underneath. A group quite commonly may only contain 2 child rows, so something at the top or bottom of grid doesn't really work. It needs to be part of the group itself. I don't think this is currently possible, but would it be difficult to implement?


### Examples

_No response_

### Motivation

_No response_


**Search keywords**: group grid

**Order ID**: 45466
issues.summary: [data grid] Group row at bottom?

issues.title: [pickers] using date-fns adapter with time format KK (Hour [0-11]) does not display properly
issues.author: rvspin
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce Steps: Link to live example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/6zc5pnrz?file=src%2FDemo.tsx 1. Change the hours in any of the picker. ### Current behavior The default time is set to 00:32:00 but is showing "KK:32:00 PM" in the field. When changing the hours in the picker, KK is still retained in the field display. ### Expected behavior Fields should show "00:32:00 PM" as default and get updated when hours are changed in the picker. ### Context We need to accommodate different date and time formats in the date time picker. We've chosen date-fns as the adapter as it has most of the formats we support, and based on the [docs](https://date-fns.org/v4.1.0/docs/format) this particular format is supported. ### Your environment
npx @mui/envinfo ``` System: OS: macOS 15.7.3 Binaries: Node: 22.14.0 npm: 11.6.2 pnpm: 10.9.0 Browsers: Chrome: 144.0.7559.133 npmPackages: @emotion/react: ^11.13.0 => 11.14.0 @emotion/styled: ^11.13.0 => 11.14.1 @mui/icons-material: ^6.1.3 => 6.5.0 @mui/material: ^6.4.5 => 6.5.0 @mui/x-date-pickers: ^8.27.0 => 8.27.0 @types/react: ^19.0.0 => 19.1.12 ```

issues.title: [docs] MCP server mui-mcp does not support resource listing
issues.author: f1eeman
issues.body:
### Related page

https://mui.com/material-ui/getting-started/mcp/#vs-code-cursor-windsurf

### Kind of issue

Other

### Issue description

When trying to use MUI X components (e.g., DateField, DateCalendar) in conjunction with MUI MCP server in Windsurf v1.13.9, i encounter the following error: 
`Failure listing resources: server mui-mcp does not support resources`
The documentation does not provide guidance on handling MCP server limitations, which leads to integration issues.

### Context

Windsurf v1.13.9
```
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "mui-mcp": {
      "args": [
        "-y",
        "@mui/mcp@latest"
      ],
      "command": "npx",
      "disabled": false
  }
}
```

**Search keywords**: MCP, mui-mcp, Failure listing resources, resource listing, x-date-pickers
issues.summary: [docs] MCP server mui-mcp does not support resource listing

issues.title: [data grid] Screen reader over-reads DOM after rowReordering live region announcement
issues.author: rhysmitchell
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the StackBlitz demo: [https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-pf9vrxek](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vitejs-vite-pf9vrxek)  
2. Move a row using the row action menu ("Move up"/"Move down")  
3. Observe that the live region (role="status", aria-live="assertive") announces the move, but **immediately after, the screen reader dictates the entire grid DOM**, overwhelming the intended message

### Current behavior

- Row visually moves as expected  
- Screen reader does announce the move, but **followed by the entire DOM of the grid**, making the live region message effectively unreadable or confusing

### Expected behavior

- Row moves always trigger clear, concise screen reader announcements in the live region  
- Announcement reflects the new position, e.g., "John Doe moved to row 2 of 5"  
- Works consistently for both menu-triggered moves and drag-and-drop reordering, **without reading the entire DOM afterwards**

### Context

- Custom live region implemented as a sibling Box element, visually hidden but with role="status" and aria-live="assertive"  
- Includes `announce()` helper and `RowActionsCell` component for moving rows  
- Intended to improve accessibility for keyboard and screen reader users

### Your environment

- OS: Windows 11  
- Browser: Latest Edge  
- Screen reader: NVDA  

**Search keywords**: MUI, DataGridPro, rowReordering, live region, screen reader, accessibility, aria-live
issues.summary: [data grid] Screen reader over-reads DOM after rowReordering live region announcement

issues.title: [data grid] Grouping with checkbox selection and server-side-data
issues.author: leonhardanthony
issues.body:
### Steps to reproduce Steps: 1. [Open this link to live example: (required)](https://stackblitz.com/edit/b2syssnr?file=src%2FDemo.tsx) 2. Use any exable in the grouping with server side Data and add checkboxSelection ### Current behavior I have a data grid with server-side data, grouping, and checkbox selection. 1. Issue: When a group is selected and then expanded, both the group and its corresponding children become deselected. This happens even if the children were previously loaded and then collapsed and expanded again. Steps to Reproduce: • Select a group. • Expand it. (Note: This also occurs if the children were loaded previously.) 2. Issue: When you select one child in a group that has multiple children, the parent’s checkbox state becomes indeterminate. If you then close the parent group, it loses its indeterminate state and is not selected (this also applies to any grandparent groups). Upon reopening the group, the previously selected row is deselected again. Steps to Reproduce: • Open a group with multiple children (if the group has nested groups, open them until you see children). • Select one or multiple children, but not all (so the group becomes indeterminate). • Close the group. 3. Issue: The behavior described in Issue 2 can also be reproduced without server-side data but only with the "select all" checkbox (see https://stackblitz.com/edit/oplssymg?file=src%2FDemo.tsx). Steps to Reproduce: • Select a group with multiple children. • Deselect one child so that the group’s state becomes indeterminate. • Close the group. ### Expected behavior _No response_ ### Context _No response_ ### Your environment
npx @mui/envinfo ``` Don't forget to mention which browser you used. Output from `npx @mui/envinfo` goes here. ```
